Sure, here are some more statistics related to the blended clothing business:

1. According to a survey, 75% of millennials are willing to pay more for sustainable clothing, highlighting the growing demand for eco-friendly clothing options among younger consumers.
2. The market for recycled cotton is also growing, with the global recycled cotton market expected to reach $5.4 billion by 2027.
3. The blended clothing business can help reduce the environmental impact of the textile industry, which is one of the largest polluting industries in the world. The textile industry is responsible for 10% of global carbon emissions and uses huge amounts of water and energy.
4. The global market for organic cotton is also growing, with the market expected to reach $7.3 billion by 2027.
5. The blended clothing business can help support the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), particularly SDG 12 (Responsible Consumption and Production) and SDG 8 (Decent Work and Economic Growth) by promoting sustainable production and creating employment opportunities in the local economy.

Overall, these statistics suggest that the blended clothing business has a strong potential for growth, particularly among younger consumers who are increasingly conscious of their environmental impact and willing to pay more for sustainable and eco-friendly products. By promoting sustainable production practices and supporting the local economy, the blended clothing business can also contribute to the achievement of important global development goals.
